overview:
After 20 years of working with the Israeli media and with a solid marcom background in a leading multinational company (Apple), Nahum Donitza established Donitza PR-DMC in 1995 as a strategic consulting, media and public relations agency. From the outset, Donitza adopted a unique perspective on public relations, taking care to combine strategic consulting and tactical execution.

Nahum Donitza holds a master degree from the Institute of Communication of the Hebrew University in Jerusalem. He has obtained his bachelor degree in Sociology in Haifa University. After his graduation, he spent ten years in a series of senior editing positions in the Israeli press, starting as a news editor in a daily newspaper, moving through two editor positions in Israel’s two local press chains, to the editing of dedicated magazines.

Among others, Nahum Donitza has edited the computer and internet supplement of the Yediot Acharonot daily (largest daily in Israel). He is a regular contributor to the technology and economics sections of Haaretz, the Otot Magazine, and the Status and Executive management magazines. He is member of the editorial board of AV, the audio-video magazine and runs a very popular blog dedicated to the “behind the scenes of the PR industry” which deals, mostly, with social media. By way of hobby, Nahum edits Yam, Israel’s divers’ magazine and the iDive website.
